solution_line_template: If Emery took {emery_days} days to read the book, then it took Serena {reading_speed_factor}*{emery_days} = <<{emery_days}*{reading_speed_factor}={serena_days}>>{serena_days} days to read the whole book.
The total number of days taken by the two to read the book is {serena_days}+{emery_days} = <<{serena_days}+{emery_days}={total_days_taken}>>{total_days_taken} days.
The average number of days the two take to read the book is {total_days_taken}/{number_of_readers} = <<{total_days_taken}/{number_of_readers}={average_days}>>{average_days} days.
